feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued June 27 at 10:34PM AKDT until June 28 at 9:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area, Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area, Glacier Bay and Southern Inner Channels.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Glacier Bay; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area; Southern Inner Channels

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 27 at 1:58PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...POTENTIAL FLOODING OF AREA RIVERS DUE TO ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES... Very warm and well above normal temperatures are expected to continue into mid week. These near record high temperatures will increase snow and ice melt and subsequent water-levels of area rivers including the Chilkat, Klehini, and Taiya.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway

entry.summary: ...DENSE SMOKE ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Visibility less than one mile in dense smoke. * WHERE...Central Interior. * WHEN...Until 1 PM AKDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility. Poor air quality.

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued June 27 at 3:01PM HST until June 28 at 6:00AM HST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR ALL SOUTH FACING SHORES... .The recent long period south swell is maintaining advisory level surf along many southern coasts today. Although this swell is falling today, another swell pulse from the south should keep south shore surf elevated to near advisory heights into and possibly through Tuesday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 2:56PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Breezy and very dry conditions Tuesday. A weather feature moving through the state will promote increased west-southwest winds Tuesday afternoon and evening across much of northwestern and northern Nevada. Winds will increase throughout the day on Tuesday reaching 15 to 25 mph with gusts of 30 to 35 mph Tuesday afternoon and evening. The breezy winds will combine
entry.cap:areaDesc: Humboldt County; Northern Elko County; Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County
